notes: Local fix implemented: packages/dotfiles/shell/beads-prefix-fix.sh wraps bd to strip prefix before passing IDs. Survives upstream updates. PR upstream when time permits.

title: [HIGH] IDOR vulnerability in taste insights API
description: ## Description The /api/taste/insights endpoint accepts a userId parameter directly from the query string without validating that the authenticated user is authorized to access that user's data. An attacker can enumerate and access any user's taste reading history, study patterns, and profile by simply changing the userId parameter.  ## Details - **Severity**: high - **Category**: auth - **Reviewer**: security - **File**: `packages/ltd/src/routes/api/taste/insights/+server.ts`:156  ## Suggested
close_reason: Fixed: now requires auth and uses authenticated user ID

title: Add model escalation to Ralph loops
description:
Implement --escalate flag for Ralph loops to automatically escalate from Haiku → Sonnet → Opus on repeated failures.

Acceptance criteria:
- /ralph-loop accepts --escalate flag
- Default escalation threshold: 5 iterations per model
- Escalation path: haiku → sonnet → opus
- Optional --escalation-threshold to customize
- Optional --start-model to begin at sonnet/opus
- Matches harness escalation pattern for consistency
- Documentation in ralph-patterns.md (already written)

Cost impact:
- Without: 15 iterations × Haiku = ~$0.015 (60% success)
- With: Average ~$0.035 (90% success)
- Trade-off: 2.3x cost, 1.5x success rate

See .claude/rules/ralph-patterns.md for full specification.

## Objective
Validate the new harness patterns documented in .claude/rules/harness-patterns.md

## Test Cases

### 1. Verification Status Flow
- [ ] Create test issue
- [ ] Mark `code-complete` after unit tests pass
- [ ] Mark `verified` after E2E check
- [ ] Close with commit reference
- [ ] Verify checkpoint shows correct status categories

### 2. One-Feature Enforcement
- [ ] Run `one-feature-guard.sh` with 0 issues in progress
- [ ] Run with 1 issue in progress (should pass)
- [ ] Simulate scope violation (2+ in progress)
- [ ] Test violation recovery procedure

### 3. Session Startup Protocol
- [ ] Test Beads context recovery commands
- [ ] Verify `bd list --status=closed --since=24h` output
- [ ] Test init.sh template in packages/space

### 4. Initializer Session Pattern
- [ ] Create mock spec file
- [ ] Test setup issue creation with harness:setup label
- [ ] Verify dependency blocking works

## Acceptance Criteria
- All test cases pass
- Patterns work with current Beads v0.34.0
- No new infrastructure required (DRY with Beads)

## Notes
Based on Anthropic harness research integration.

title: Paper: Workers vs Python SDK for Webflow Plagiarism Detection
description: Compare the Workers implementation (vision + code analysis) vs Python SDK (AST + vision) for detecting plagiarism in Webflow templates. Key finding: Workers achieved same accuracy as Python SDK while being faster and cheaper. Vision analysis is critical for GUI-based tools like Webflow where code similarity can be 0% despite visual plagiarism.

title: Build-time Canon validation via ESLint/Svelte rules
description:
Enforce Canon tokens at build time, not just audit time.

## Why
Currently Canon violations are discovered via /audit-canon (manual). NanoLang's shadow test pattern shows: constraints should be intrinsic, not external. Build failures > audit findings.

## Approach
1. ESLint plugin that reads canon.json
2. Flags Tailwind design utilities (bg-white, text-gray-*, rounded-*, etc.)
3. Suggests Canon token replacements
4. Svelte preprocessor or eslint-plugin-svelte integration

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `pnpm build` fails on Canon violations
- [ ] Error messages include Canon token suggestion
- [ ] Can be disabled per-file with directive
- [ ] Experimental routes can opt-out (per css-canon.md policy)

## Dependencies
- canon.json (csm-uco8) ✓ Complete

## References
- NanoLang shadow tests: constraints in syntax
- css-canon.md: Detection Patterns section
close_reason: ESLint plugin now reads canon.json as single source of truth. Fixed Svelte detection.

title: Implement bd work command in Beads
description:
Implement the unified entry point for harness orchestration.

## Why
Currently harness is conceptual (harness-patterns.md). Need concrete implementation to validate patterns and collect metrics for stabilization.

## Scope
```bash
bd work <issue-id>              # Work on existing issue
bd work --create "Task"         # Create and work
bd work --spec specs/file.md    # Parse spec, create issues, work
```

## Implementation
1. Complexity detection from issue description + file analysis
2. Model selection (haiku/sonnet/opus) based on complexity
3. Session spawning via Claude Code Task tool
4. Metrics collection to Beads metadata

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `bd work cs-xxx` marks issue in_progress and spawns session
- [ ] Complexity detection logged
- [ ] Model selection logged
- [ ] Session completion closes issue with commit ref

## Blocked By
- Beads core stability (already stable)
close_reason: Commit: 31d9510 - harness work command implemented with complexity detection and model routing

title: Apply plugin catalog pattern to LMS: modules as installable learning units
description:
Translate the plugin catalog pattern from createsomething.io/plugins to LMS courses.

## Pattern Mapping

| Plugin Concept | Learning Equivalent |
|----------------|---------------------|
| Commands (/audit-canon) | Exercises (/practice-3) |
| Agents (canon-auditor) | AI tutors / learning assistants |
| Skills (Subtractive Review) | Competencies / badges |
| Hooks (PostToolUse) | Progress tracking triggers |

## Implementation

1. Module detail page shows "What You'll Learn" (features) and "What You Get" (exercises, tutors, certs)
2. Enrollment via CLI or web (like plugin install)
3. Progress tracked through hooks
4. Applies to both learn.createsomething.space and learn.workway.co

## Reference

See createsomething.io/plugins for the source pattern.

title: YAML spec schema for harness specifications
description:
Replace Markdown specs with structured YAML for unambiguous parsing.

## Why
NanoLang principle: unambiguous syntax reduces LLM errors. Current Markdown specs require interpretation. YAML + JSON Schema enables machine validation.

## Depends On
- Harness stabilization (bd work implemented, patterns validated)

## Schema Design
```yaml
$schema: https://createsomething.ltd/schemas/harness-spec.yaml
feature: string
property: space | io | agency | ltd
complexity: trivial | simple | standard | complex
files: string[]
requires: string[]
acceptance:
  - test: string
    verify: string  # Command to run
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] JSON Schema published
- [ ] `bd work --spec` validates against schema
- [ ] Invalid specs rejected with clear errors
- [ ] Migration guide from Markdown specs

title: VC Pattern Adoption - Phase 1
description:
Parent epic for Phase 1 adoption of patterns from Steve Yegge's VC (VibeCoder) project.

## Context

VC is the canonical reference implementation for Beads - Steve Yegge created Beads, and VC demonstrates how agent orchestration should work. CREATE SOMETHING adopts these patterns while adapting them to our Heideggerian philosophy (tool recedes into use).

## Phase 1 Items

1. **csm-xz24**: Expand discovered label taxonomy (harness:blocker, harness:related, harness:supervisor)
2. **csm-w6i2**: Pause/resume with context preservation (nondeterministic idempotence)
3. **csm-pa4v**: Self-healing baseline (preflight checks, auto-fix)

## Already Completed

- Zero Framework Cognition added to CLAUDE.md
- Quality gates documented in harness-patterns.md
- Work extraction implemented (createIssueFromFinding, extractWorkFromFindings)
- VC added to taste-reference.md

## Philosophy

These patterns close the hermeneutic loop: work creates findings → findings create work. The Subtractive Triad applies:
- **DRY**: Labels encode discovery source once, used everywhere
- **Rams**: Only labels that earn their existence
- **Heidegger**: Patterns serve the whole system

## Success Criteria

- All Phase 1 items implemented
- Harness sessions can pause/resume with context
- Broken baseline triggers self-healing
- Work extraction uses proper label taxonomy

## Provenance

https://github.com/steveyegge/vc

title: Phase 1: VC Pattern Adoption for Harness
description:
Adopt foundational patterns from Steve Yegge's VC project to evolve CREATE SOMETHING harness toward autonomous orchestration.

VC represents the canonical Beads implementation - Yegge created Beads. These patterns have been validated through 254 closed issues, 24 missions, and 90.9% quality gate pass rate.

Phase 1 Focus: Foundation for autonomous work
1. csm-zrh7: Expand discovered label taxonomy
2. csm-waiq: Add pause/resume with AgentContext preservation
3. csm-qp8r: Implement self-healing baseline

Philosophy: This adoption doesn't conflict with Heideggerian Zuhandenheit - it's the same trajectory. Tools that work autonomously recede even more completely than tools requiring constant attention. The goal: infrastructure disappears, only the work remains.

Reference: ~/Documents/Github/vc (cloned canonical implementation)
Provenance: Steve Yegge interview - 'factory farming code' vision

title: Enhance claude-plugins with proper agent definitions per Plugin Reference spec
description:
Based on the official Plugin Reference documentation, our plugins should have properly structured agents in `agents/` directories with full YAML frontmatter.

## Current State
Our plugins have agents defined but may not follow the full spec.

## Required Agent Structure (per docs)

```markdown
---
name: agent-name
description: Description including "use proactively" for auto-invocation
tools: tool1, tool2, tool3  # Specific tools or inherit all
model: sonnet  # or opus, haiku, inherit
permissionMode: default  # or acceptEdits, bypassPermissions, plan
skills: skill1, skill2  # Auto-load skills
---

System prompt with detailed instructions...
```

## Plugins to Update

### canon
- Agent: `canon-auditor`
- Tools: Read, Grep, Glob (read-only audit)
- Model: haiku (fast checks)
- Description: "Proactively audit files for Canon compliance after code changes"

### hermeneutic-review
- Agent: `hermeneutic-reviewer`
- Tools: Read, Grep, Glob, Bash (for git diff)
- Model: sonnet (deeper analysis)
- Description: "Use proactively before PRs to apply DRY → Rams → Heidegger analysis"

### voice-validator
- Agent: could add `voice-auditor` for proactive content checks
- Tools: Read, Grep, Glob
- Model: haiku
- Description: "Proactively check content files for Voice compliance"

### understanding-graphs
- No agent currently—skill only
- Could add `codebase-navigator` agent

## Key Insights from Docs

1. **Proactive invocation**: Include "use proactively" or "MUST BE USED" in description
2. **Tool limitation**: Only grant necessary tools for security
3. **Model selection**: Use haiku for fast tasks, sonnet for complex analysis
4. **Resumable agents**: Agents can be resumed with agentId for long-running tasks

## Reference
https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code/plugins-reference#agents

title: Determine footer behavior with Canon DocSidebar
description:
The main site footer overlaps the fixed DocSidebar on /canon/* routes. Need to determine the correct relationship:

Options:
1. Footer respects sidebar (margin-left: 280px on desktop)
2. Hide footer entirely on /canon routes (docs don't need it)
3. Footer scrolls within content area only
4. Sidebar ends before footer reaches

Heideggerian consideration: The footer is currently Vorhandenheit (present-at-hand)—it demands attention through broken layout. Must restore Zuhandenheit (ready-to-hand) where it either serves transparently or doesn't exist.

Canon principle: 'Weniger, aber besser'—if the sidebar already provides navigation, does the footer earn its existence on doc pages?

Files:
- packages/ltd/src/routes/canon/+layout.svelte
- packages/ltd/src/routes/+layout.svelte (where Footer lives)
- packages/ltd/src/lib/components/Footer.svelte
close_reason: Verified: commit 4b9976c. Footer hidden on /canon routes. The sidebar provides sufficient navigation for documentation dwelling.

title: Strip creator-injected JSON-LD schema from template marketplace previews
description:
Template creators are adding their own JSON-LD schema markup (e.g., SportsActivityLocation on Fuerza, custom schema on Awakee) which appears on Webflow marketplace pages and conflicts with the template page schema.

**Root cause**: Google crawls iframe src URLs (*.webflow.io template previews) separately and attributes their schema to the parent marketplace page.

**Fix**: Add `<meta name="robots" content="noindex, nofollow">` to individual template preview sites that have problematic schema.

**Affected templates**:
- Fuerza (fuerza.webflow.io) - SportsActivityLocation schema
- Awakee - custom schema

**Limitation**: Only have access to Marketplace and individual templates, not webflow.io infrastructure.
close_reason: Fixed at Marketplace level: iframe now uses data-src with JS lazy-loading, preventing Google from crawling template preview URLs

title: Implement self-healing baseline (VC pattern)
description:
Implement self-healing baseline so the harness can auto-fix environment issues before starting real work (upstream from Steve Yegge's VC project).

## Problem

Sessions can fail because baseline is broken (tests failing from previous work, lint errors, type errors). This wastes cycles on environment issues rather than real work.

## Implementation

1. **Preflight check** (before claiming work):
   - Run `pnpm test` with quick timeout
   - Run `pnpm lint` on changed files
   - Run `tsc --noEmit` for type check

2. **Self-healing flow** (on preflight failure):
   - Create P1 issue: 'Self-heal: Fix baseline {test|lint|types}'
   - Add harness:self-heal label
   - Agent receives targeted prompt to fix specific failures
   - Re-run preflight after fix
   - Only proceed to claimed work once baseline is green

3. **Configuration in harness-spec.yaml**:
   ```yaml
   preflight:
     test: pnpm test --filter=$PACKAGE
     lint: pnpm lint --filter=$PACKAGE
     types: pnpm --filter=$PACKAGE exec tsc --noEmit
     timeout: 60s
     self_heal: true  # Auto-create fix issues
   ```

## Rationale

VC's quality gates achieve 90.9% pass rate by ensuring clean baseline. Self-healing prevents the 'broken window' effect where one failure cascades into session failure.

## Success Criteria

- Preflight runs before every harness session
- Baseline failures create targeted self-heal issues
- Agent can fix common failures (import errors, missing deps, lint violations)
- Session only proceeds once preflight passes

## Provenance

Steve Yegge's VC FEATURES.md: 'Self-healing recoveries' and quality gate patterns.
close_reason: Duplicate - work already tracked in csm-ifqs epic (csm-zrh7, csm-waiq, csm-qp8r)

Implement self-healing baseline for harness sessions
description:
Adopt VC pattern: Auto-fix failing tests before starting new work.

VC runs quality gates (test/lint/build) at session start. If baseline fails:
1. Attempt auto-fix of simple failures
2. Create blocking issues for complex failures
3. Prevent new work from starting on broken baseline

This prevents the 'broken windows' problem where existing failures mask new regressions.

Implementation:
- Add baseline check to harness initialization
- Run quality gates before claiming work
- Auto-create blocker issues for failures
- Track baseline health over time (VC reports 90.9% pass rate)

Reference: VC DOGFOODING.md quality gates section
Provenance: Steve Yegge's VC project (canonical Beads implementation)
close_reason: Commit: ef7e92f - Implemented self-healing baseline quality gates

Write comprehensive paper about webflow-dashboard refactor using paper skill
description: Create a detailed technical paper documenting the webflow-dashboard port from Next.js to SvelteKit. [CRITICAL] HTML sanitizer corrupts valid HTML output
description: ## Description The sanitizeHtml function at Step 4 encodes ALL < and > characters to < and >, then attempts to restore valid tags via regex. This approach corrupts valid HTML because (1) the restoration regex only matches a subset of allowed tags, missing 'table', 'thead', 'tbody', 'tr', 'th', 'td' closing tags, (2) attributes containing < or > will break, and (3) nested tags may not be properly restored. For example, '' would remain as '</table>' after sanitization. ## Deta

title: Add canon.json - machine-readable Canon tokens
description:
Extract machine-readable Canon tokens from tokens.css into canon.json.

## Why
NanoLang uses spec.json for machine-readable language specification. We need equivalent for Canon - enables:
- Programmatic validation in /audit-canon
- Build-time enforcement (future ESLint/Svelte rules)
- Dynamic context generation

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] canon.json contains all tokens from tokens.css
- [ ] Schema validates color, spacing, typography, motion tokens
- [ ] /audit-canon can import and use canon.json
- [ ] tokens.css remains source of truth (canon.json derived)

## Location
packages/components/src/lib/styles/canon.json

title: Implement pause/resume with context preservation (VC pattern)
description:
Implement pause/resume with context preservation so harness sessions can be interrupted and resumed with full understanding of prior work (upstream from Steve Yegge's VC project).

## Problem

Currently, if a harness session is interrupted (context window limit, user interrupt, timeout), the next session starts fresh. VC solves this with 'Nondeterministic Idempotence' - AI figures out where it left off.

## Implementation

1. **Save context to checkpoint**: When generating a checkpoint, include:
   - Files modified (with diff summary)
   - Issues touched (status changes)
   - Current task progress
   - Agent's understanding of remaining work
   - Test state (what passed/failed)

2. **Resume brief on restart**: When resuming a harness session:
   - Load latest checkpoint
   - Generate 'resume brief' summarizing prior context
   - Inject into session priming prompt

3. **Schema addition to checkpoint.ts**:
   ```typescript
   interface AgentContext {
     filesModified: Array<{ path: string; summary: string }>;
     issuesUpdated: Array<{ id: string; from: string; to: string }>;
     currentTask: { issueId: string; step: string; progress: string };
     testState: { passed: number; failed: number; skipped: number };
     agentNotes: string; // Free-form AI understanding
   }
   ```

## Rationale

VC's nondeterministic idempotence principle: 'Workflows can be interrupted and resumed - AI figures out where it left off.' This prevents wasted work and enables longer-running autonomous sessions.

## Provenance

Steve Yegge's VC ARCHITECTURE.md: 'Nondeterministic Idempotence' as core principle.

title: Add pause/resume with AgentContext preservation
description:
Adopt VC pattern: Enable harness sessions to pause and resume with full context preservation.

VC implements AgentContext that captures:
- Working notes (agent's reasoning and observations)
- Current todos (in-progress task state)
- Progress markers (what's been completed)
- Blockers encountered

When pausing:
1. Serialize AgentContext to Beads issue
2. Store as structured metadata (not just text)
3. Enable any session to resume by loading context

This supports 'nondeterministic idempotence' - crash and resume anywhere, AI figures out where it left off.

Reference: VC ARCHITECTURE.md pause/resume patterns
Provenance: Steve Yegge's VC project (canonical Beads implementation)

title: Expand discovered label taxonomy (VC pattern)
description:
Expand harness:discovered label into a taxonomy that captures how work was discovered (upstream from Steve Yegge's VC project).

## Labels to Add

- **harness:blocker** - Blocking issues discovered during session (parallel to VC's discovered:blocker)
- **harness:related** - Related work discovered but not blocking
- **harness:supervisor** - Issues discovered by checkpoint review (architecture/security/quality reviewers)

## Implementation

1. Update harness-patterns.md with label taxonomy documentation
2. Modify createIssueFromFinding() in beads.ts to apply appropriate labels based on finding source
3. Add label validation to extractWorkFromFindings()

## Rationale

VC achieves 90.9% quality gate pass rate partly through discovered work taxonomy. Knowing *how* an issue was discovered informs priority and resolution strategy. Blocker issues need immediate attention; supervisor findings may batch into refactoring sessions.

## Provenance

Steve Yegge's VC project uses discovered:blocker, discovered:related, discovered:supervisor. We adapt to harness: prefix for namespace clarity within CREATE SOMETHING.

title: [HIGH] XSS via unsanitized HTML rendering
description: ## Description The {@html data.asset.rejectionFeedbackHtml} directive renders raw HTML from the Airtable database without sanitization. If an attacker can inject malicious content into the Airtable field (e.g., via admin access or API manipulation), they could execute arbitrary JavaScript in users' browsers.  ## Details - **Severity**: high - **Category**: injection - **Reviewer**: security - **File**: :166  ## Suggested Fix Sanitiz
close_reason: Fixed by sanitizing HTML content in airtable.ts before rendering. Added sanitize.ts utility that strips dangerous elements/attributes while preserving safe formatting.

This means any schema change requires updating both files.  ## Details - **Severity**: high - **Category**: dry - **Reviewer**: architecture - **File**: `packages/ltd/src/routes/taste/insights/+page.server.ts`:196  ## Suggested Fix Create a shared data

title: Expand discovered label taxonomy for harness work extraction
description:
Adopt VC pattern: Expand the discovered work taxonomy to capture different types of findings during harness sessions.

Current: createIssueFromFinding uses generic 'discovered-from' dependency
Target: Add specific labels to categorize discovered work:
- harness:blocker - Issue blocks current work, must address immediately
- harness:related - Related work discovered, can be scheduled separately  
- harness:supervisor - AI supervisor identified architectural concern

This enables smarter work prioritization and helps the harness decide whether to continue or pause.

Reference: VC FEATURES.md work extraction patterns
Provenance: Steve Yegge's VC project (canonical Beads implementation)
